Why hasn’t the Sun burned out yet?

item.title:
As AI becomes part of our everyday lives, how do we make sure it aligns with human values?
In @PNASNews, we draw inspiration from philosophy to understand how to select AI principles in a world with diverse opinions and beliefs.
Here's what we found. 🧵 https://t.co/RF7SaSYhx3 https://t.co/AeAd8obpiL
item.description:
As AI becomes part of our everyday lives, how do we make sure it aligns with human values?
In @PNASNews, we draw inspiration from philosophy to understand how to select AI principles in a world with diverse opinions and beliefs.
Here's what we found. 🧵 https://t.co/RF7SaSYhx3 https://t.co/AeAd8obpiL

item.title:
Creating ethical AI systems means aligning them with human values, such as helping those in need or boosting overall productivity.
But people disagree about which goal matters most.
We used the famous Veil of Ignorance concept to address this challenge: https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j https://t.co/mcL1xXfLSe
item.description:
Creating ethical AI systems means aligning them with human values, such as helping those in need or boosting overall productivity.
But people disagree about which goal matters most.
We used the famous Veil of Ignorance concept to address this challenge: https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j https://t.co/mcL1xXfLSe

item.title:
🔵 In this thought experiment, people should imagine they are selecting principles for society without knowing their own position.
As a result, they become less likely to make decisions in a self-interested way.
Instead, they’ll choose values that are fair to everyone involved. https://t.co/4rbDVod6C7
item.description:
🔵 In this thought experiment, people should imagine they are selecting principles for society without knowing their own position.
As a result, they become less likely to make decisions in a self-interested way.
Instead, they’ll choose values that are fair to everyone involved. https://t.co/4rbDVod6C7

item.title:
🟢 The Veil of Ignorance has been used as a popular method to reach agreement on contentious questions.
We designed a series of online experiments to test its effects on the principles that people select for an AI system.
How did these games work? ⬇️ https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j
item.description:
🟢 The Veil of Ignorance has been used as a popular method to reach agreement on contentious questions.
We designed a series of online experiments to test its effects on the principles that people select for an AI system.
How did these games work? ⬇️ https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j

item.title:
🪵 Players in groups had to gather wood by harvesting trees in separate territories.
Some members were lucky: their areas had many trees, meaning they could gather wood more quickly.
Others were less fortunate: their territories were sparse, requiring more effort to succeed. https://t.co/EvLAZ3cGmi
item.description:
🪵 Players in groups had to gather wood by harvesting trees in separate territories.
Some members were lucky: their areas had many trees, meaning they could gather wood more quickly.
Others were less fortunate: their territories were sparse, requiring more effort to succeed. https://t.co/EvLAZ3cGmi

item.title:
🌳 Groups were aided by an AI system that could help people harvest trees.
We asked participants to pick between two principles to guide the AI’s behaviour: 1️⃣ To maximise the harvest of the group, or 2️⃣ To prioritise the disadvantaged members.
https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j https://t.co/pyR0JZcxbs
item.description:
🌳 Groups were aided by an AI system that could help people harvest trees.
We asked participants to pick between two principles to guide the AI’s behaviour: 1️⃣ To maximise the harvest of the group, or 2️⃣ To prioritise the disadvantaged members.
https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j https://t.co/pyR0JZcxbs

item.title:
🤔 What were the findings?
Across five studies, players consistently preferred helping disadvantaged members when reasoning from behind the Veil.
These participants also tended to opt for the prioritising principle regardless of their appetite for risk or political orientation. https://t.co/qrJSMyUFWq
item.description:
🤔 What were the findings?
Across five studies, players consistently preferred helping disadvantaged members when reasoning from behind the Veil.
These participants also tended to opt for the prioritising principle regardless of their appetite for risk or political orientation. https://t.co/qrJSMyUFWq

item.title:
🔵 Why does this matter?
Identifying ethical principles to govern AI is a key challenge.
The Veil of Ignorance may give a starting point for alignment, encouraging people to choose values for AI that are motivated by fairness instead of self-interest: https://t.co/MJMwMyli0j

item.title:
@HenryYin19 Very interesting. But, what then do you make of the fact that DA VTA activation can be used to guide behaviour? Does that not speak to a clear role in shaping behavioural policy (whether as an RPE or something else)?
https://t.co/qhjgslbLY1
item.description:
@HenryYin19 Very interesting. But, what then do you make of the fact that DA VTA activation can be used to guide behaviour? Does that not speak to a clear role in shaping behavioural policy (whether as an RPE or something else)?
https://t.co/qhjgslbLY1

item.title: @tyrell_turing Sure it can be used to guide behavior, as we said in the paper. But shaping behavioral policy is not learning. You can't equate learning with a change in performance, though RL models typically do that. That's the oldest problem in the study of learning.
item.description: @tyrell_turing Sure it can be used to guide behavior, as we said in the paper. But shaping behavioral policy is not learning. You can't equate learning with a change in performance, though RL models typically do that. That's the oldest problem in the study of learning.

item.title:
#DidYouKnow? A single gene can make many different proteins with unique functions all depending on how that gene gets “read.”
Julia Salzman + David Tse are building tools to analyze how different cells regulate this process #DNADay23 https://t.co/DYhV8CKQbx
